children.name: bad
children.definition: not at all pleasant, enjoyable, or successful:
examples: tệ, dở , xấu
▪ If the weather’s bad, we could go to the museum instead.
▪ bad housing conditions
bad newsnews of a bad event : tin xấu
▪ I’m afraid I have some bad news.
a bad day/year/time etcwhen a lot of unpleasant things happen
▪ This was a very bad year for the banking industry.
▪ It had been a bad day, and I just wanted to go home.

children.name: awful/terrible/dreadful
children.definition: very bad:
examples: tồi tệ, kinh khủng, tệ hại,
▪ The weather has been terrible lately.
▪ Traffic in the downtown Boston area is awful.
▪ Conditions in the hospital were dreadful. The place was falling apart and it was understaffed.

children.name: appalling/atrocious
children.definition: so bad that you areshocked:

children.name: kinh khủng
examples: ▪ Living conditions in the refugee camps were atrocious.
▪ The appalling weather continued, with harsh winds, fogs and heavy rain.

children.name: horrendous
children.definition: extremelybad, unpleasant, and often frightening:

children.name: khủng khiếp
examples: ▪ It was a horrendous storm.
▪ She is still recovering from a horrendous car accident.

children.name: horrific
children.definition: extremelybad, especially in a way that is frightening or upsetting:

children.name: kinh khủng, khủng khiếp
examples: ▪ It was a horrific experience. We really thought we were going to die.
▪ The race was stopped after a horrific accident in which two drivers were killed.

children.name: be a nightmare
children.definition: use this to talk about anextremelybad experience or situation:

children.name: là một ác mộng
examples: ▪ The traffic coming in to work this morning was a nightmare.
▪ The President’s trip turned out to be a nightmare for his security staff.

children.name: be a complete nightmare
examples: ▪ Our vacation was a complete nightmare. The weather was awful and our hotel was worse.

children.name: bad
children.definition: something that is bad is of alow standard,because it has been done badly, designed badly, performed badly etc:

children.name: tệ, dở
examples: ▪ The movie was so bad that we left before it finished.

children.name: bộ phim quá tệ đến nỗi chúng tôi đã bỏ đi trước khi nó hết
examples: ▪ It’s the worst book she’s ever written.

children.name: Đó là cuốn sách tệ nhất mà cô ấy từng viết
examples: ▪ Opponents of the plan say it is a bad way of managing city traffic.

children.name: Những người phản đối kế hoạch nói rằng đó là một cách quản lí giao thông tồi tệ của thành phố
examples: ▪ In the 1980s, their cars had a bad reputation for reliability.

children.name: Vào những năm 1980 những chiếc xe của họ đã có tiếng xấu về độ tin cậy
examples: ▪ Their latest album is even worse than their last one.

children.name: Album mới nhất của họ thậm chí còn tệ hon album lần trước
no good
children.definition: not good at all:

children.name: không hay, thú vị, ngon... chút nào
examples: ▪ I wouldn’t go there - the food’s no good.

children.name: Tôi không đi tới đó đâu - đồ ăn không ngon chút nào
examples: ▪ I’ve tried that diet, and it’s no good.

children.name: Tôi đã thử ăn món đó rồi - nó không ngon chút nào
awful/terrible/appalling
children.definition: /lousy  very bad:
examples: tồi tệ, kinh khủng, tệ hại,
▪ That’s such an awful programme! How can you watch it?
Đó là một chương trình dở tệ - Làm sao mà anh có thể xem nó được ?
▪ Your handwriting is appalling.

children.name: Chữ viết của anh xấu quá
examples: ▪ The food was lousy and the service was terrible.

children.name: Thức ăn rất dở và dịch vụ thì rất tệ
garbage/ garbage
children.definition: rubbishBritish informal /garbageespecially American   use this to describe something you think is very bad:
examples: rác rưởi
▪ ‘What did you think of his speech?’ ‘I thought it was rubbish!’
"Anh nghĩ gì về bài phát biểu đó? " Tôi nghĩ nó rất tệ"
▪ Most of the food in these fast food joints is garbage.
"Hầu hết các thức ăn của các món ăn nhanh đều rất dở"
a load of rubbish/garbage : đống rác rưởi
▪ I don’t know why you’re watching that film, it’s a load of old rubbish.
Tôi không hiểu sao anh lại xem bộ phim đó, toàn là một đống rác rưởi
▪ I’ve never read such a load of garbage in my life.
Tôi chưa bao giờ đọc một đống thứ rác rưởi như vậy trong cuộc đời tôi.

children.name: dreadful
children.definition: especially British very bad:

children.name: kinh khủng
examples: ▪ The coffee tasted dreadful!

children.name: ▪ ‘How did you like the film?’ ‘I thought it was dreadful.’
crap
children.definition: use this to describe something you think is very bad -- some people think this word isoffensive:

children.name: cứt ( thô tục )
examples: ▪ There’s nothing but crap on television these days.
▪ The stereo’s great but the rest of the car is crap.

children.name: a load of crap : 1 đống cứt
examples: ▪ Someone told me it was a really interesting museum, but I thought it was a load of crap.

children.name: suck
children.definition: especially American,informalif you say that something sucks, you think it is very bad -- some people think this word isoffensive:

children.name: mút, bú ( thô tục )
examples: ▪ Let’s not go there -- the food sucks.

children.name: products that are badly made or of bad quality
poor quality
children.definition: poor quality products have been made badly:
examples: chất lượng kém
▪ Poor quality housing often leads to health problems.
Chất lượng nhà ở kém thường dẫn đến các vấn đề về sức khỏe
be of poor quality: chất lượng kém
▪ Investigators believe the bridge collapsed because the concrete was of poor quality.
Những nhà điều tra tin rằng cầu đường sụp đổ là vì betong có chất lượng kém

children.name: badly made
children.definition: made without care or skill:

children.name: chất lượng kém
examples: ▪ Her clothes looked cheap and badly made.

children.name: Quần áo của cô ta trông thật rẻ tiền và thiếu đầu tư
cheap
children.definition: cheap furniture, jewellery, clothes etc look unattractive and badly made, and seem to have been produced using low quality materials:

children.name: rẻ tiền
examples: ▪ The room was depressing, with dim light and cheap furniture.

children.name: Căn phòng trông thật buồn tẻ, với ánh sáng lờ mờ và đồ nội thất rẻ tiền
examples: ▪ Hungry-looking men in cheap suits hung around the streets all day.

children.name: Những người đang ông trông đói khổ trong bộ quần áo rẻ tiền đi quanh phố suốt cả ngày
low quality
children.definition: low-quality  low-quality products have been made badly:

children.name: chất lượng kém
examples: ▪ It’s not worth building with low-quality materials just to save money.

children.name: Không đáng phải xây dựng với vật liệu kém chất lượng như vậy chỉ để tiết kiệm tiền
examples: ▪ The company wants to change its image as a producer of low-cost, low-quality clothes.

children.name: Công ty muốn thay đổi hình ảnh của mình thành nhà sản xuất với sản phẩm giá thấp, chất lượng thấp
shoddy
children.definition: badly and cheaply made, using low quality materials:

children.name: kém chất lượng
examples: ▪ You have a right to return any shoddy goods you might buy.

children.name: shoddily made
examples: ▪ Police officials blamed the deaths on the shoddily made apartment building.

children.name: inferior
children.definition: inferior products are not as good as other similar ones because they have been cheaply and badly made:

children.name: hạng thấp ( so với cùng loại )
examples: ▪ Consumers buy foreign goods because they believe that British-made goods are inferior.
▪ I want the best -- I don’t want some inferior model that’s going to break down the first time I use it.

children.name: not very bad but not very good
not very good
children.definition: especiallyspokennot good- use this when you aredisappointedbecause you were expecting something better:
examples: không tốt lắm ( như hy vọng )
▪ ‘What was the movie like?’ ‘It was OK but the ending wasn’t very good.’
" Bộ phim đó như thế nào? " Tôi khá ổn nhưng kết thúc không hay lắm"
▪ He’s been learning English for five years, but his pronunciation isn’t very good.
Anh ta đã học tiếng Anh được 5 năm rồi, nhưng phát âm vẫn không tốt

children.name: nothing special
children.definition: not very bad, but not especially good:
examples: không có gì đặc biệt
▪ ‘Was the food good?’ ‘It was okay, but nothing special.’
"Thức ăn như thế nào?" "Nó ổn nhưng không có gì đặc biệt"
▪ The town’s nice, but the beach is nothing special.
"Thị trấn đó khá ổn, nhưng bãi biển thì không có gì đặc biệt"

children.name: second rate
children.definition: /third rate  not as good as other things of thesamekind:

children.name: hạng hai / hạng ba
examples: ▪ People are not willing to pay a lot of money for second-rate works of art.

children.name: Mọi người không muốn trả nhiều tiền cho thứ nghệ thuật hạng hai như vậy
examples: ▪ All they could afford was a room in a second-rate hotel about a mile from the beach.

children.name: Tất cả những gì họ có thể chi trả là một căn phòng trong một khách sạn hạng hai cách bãi biển một dặm
mediocre
children.definition: something that is mediocre is of alower standardthan it should be, and does not show much quality or skill:

children.name: tầm thường, xoàng ( hơn mong đợi )
examples: ▪ The team gave another mediocre performance last night.

children.name: Ban nhạc đã có một màn biểu diễn quá xoàng tối hôm qua
examples: ▪ Tourists crowd the gift shops to buy mediocre products at high prices.
Khách du lịch đứng đông ở các cửa hàng chỉ để mua những thứ đồ tầm thường với giá cao.

children.name: all right/OK, but ...
children.definition: say this when you think that something is good in some ways but there are some bad parts of it too:

children.name: cũng ổn nhưng ... ( vẫn có điểm gì không ổn )
examples: ▪ My grades were OK, but I thought I should have gotten an ‘A’ in chemistry.
▪ The game was all right, but it wasn’t worth what I paid to watch it.

children.name: so-so
children.definition: not very good, but not very bad either:
examples: vầy vậy
▪ ‘How is your meal?’ ‘So-so.’
▪ The hotel was in a lovely location, but the facilities were only so-so.

children.name: not be up to scratch
children.definition: especially British something that is not up to scratch, is not as goodas it should be:

children.name: không đạt yêu cầu
examples: ▪ The hotels and transport system in this city are not up to scratch at the moment.

children.name: patchy
children.definition: a performance, piece of work etcthat is patchy is good in some parts, but bad in others and in general is not good:

children.name: chắp vá
examples: ▪ The film is patchy, despite one or two good performances.
▪ Many department stores reported patchy sales over Christmas.

children.name: lacklustre
children.definition: British /lacklusterAmerican   lacklustreperformancenot very bad, but not as good as wasexpected:

children.name: nhạt nhẽo
examples: ▪ The corporation’s profits increased dramatically this year, after a rather lacklustre performance last year.

children.name: words for describing bad people or behaviour
bad
children.definition: use this about behaviour that is morally wrong, or about people who do things that are morally wrong:

children.name: tệ, xấu
examples: ▪ In most movies, the bad guy gets caught in the end.

children.name: Trong hầu hết các bộ phim, kẻ xấu bị bắt vào cuối phim
examples: ▪ He had a bad influence on his younger brother.

children.name: Anh ta có ảnh hưởng xấu đến em trai mình
examples: ▪ Is there any crime worse than murdering a child?
Còn tội ác nào nghiêm trọng hơn giết một đứa trẻ không?
▪ It never occurred to Sally that the man had any bad intentions.

children.name: Sally chưa bao giờ nghĩ rằng người đàn ông đó có bất kì ý định nào xấu
immoral
children.definition: use this aboutactionsthat you believe are morally wrong and unacceptable, even if they are not illegal:

children.name: vô đạo đức ( việc làm )
examples: ▪ Many people think that testing cosmetics on animals is immoral.

children.name: Nhiều người nghĩ rằng việc thử nghiệm mỹ phẩm trên động vật là vô đạo đức
examples: ▪ To spend £23 billion on nuclear weapons is immoral, and a terrible waste of money.

children.name: Tiêu phí 23 bảng Anh cho vũ khí là một việc làm vô đạo đức và thật sự lãng phí tiền bạc
examples: ▪ Critics complain that the lyrics of the song encourage anti-social and immoral behavior.

children.name: Các nhà phê bình phàn nàn rằng lời bài hát này khuyến khích các hành vi chống đối xã hội và vô đạo đức
evil/wicked
children.definition: deliberatelyvery bad and very cruel to other people:

children.name: ác độc
examples: ▪ Police described the crime as wicked and inhuman.

children.name: Cảnh sát cho biết đây là loại tội phạm độc ác và không có tính người
examples: ▪ He was an evil man who felt no sympathy for his victims.

children.name: Ông ta là một người đàn ông xấu xa và không có sự cảm thông cho nạn nhân của mình
